issue.title: Fix crash in rpmtsCheck() if rpmtsRun() fails
issue.body:
The preexisting logic in `doCheck` is very helpful for extracting and displaying problems, but the call to `rpmtsCheck` itself should not be re-executed if the failure occurred after the initial check. Once `rpmtsClean()` has been called, data within `pTS` has been emptied and `rpmtsCheck` will segfault on NULL dereference.

Also address a few potential issues with the lifetime of the problem objects:
* The `rpmps` object is ref-counted internally and should be released with `rpmpsFree`; the latter function frees all of the problems within it when the ref count reaches 0.
* If multiple problems are reported, then `pErrorStr` needs to be freed multiple times.

---

_NOTE: This is my first (attempted) contribution to this project, so I wasn't sure how/which tests to re-run. I'd appreciate any and all feedback you have for me to make this PR acceptable._

issue.body:
The preexisting logic in `doCheck` is very helpful for extracting and displaying problems, but the call to `rpmtsCheck` itself should not be re-executed if the failure occurred after the initial check. * The `rpmps` object is ref-counted internally and should be released with `rpmpsFree`; the latter function frees all of the problems within it when the ref count reaches 0.
* If multiple problems are reported, then `pErrorStr` needs to be freed multiple times.

issue.title: CVE-2007-4559 Patch
issue.body:
# Patching CVE-2007-4559

Hi, we are security researchers from the Advanced Research Center at [Trellix](https://www.trellix.com). We have began a campaign to patch a widespread bug named CVE-2007-4559. CVE-2007-4559 is a 15 year old bug in the Python tarfile package. By using extract() or extractall() on a tarfile object without sanitizing input, a maliciously crafted .tar file could perform a directory path traversal attack. We found at least one unsantized extractall() in your codebase and are providing a patch for you via pull request. The patch essentially checks to see if all tarfile members will be extracted safely and throws an exception otherwise. We encourage you to use this patch or your own solution to secure against CVE-2007-4559. Further technical information about the vulnerability can be found in this [blog](https://www.trellix.com/en-us/about/newsroom/stories/research/tarfile-exploiting-the-world.html).

If you have further questions you may contact us through this projects lead researcher [Kasimir Schulz](mailto:kasimir.schulz@trellix.com).

issue.title: DRAFT: Add nx
issue.body:
# Description
I am not able to  get a publishable library to depend on another unless I set tsconfig's `paths` to point to the `dist` directory. I get the following kinds of errors when I run `nx build components` and `components` depends on `i18n`. This does not seem to be the way that nx wants things since when I create two publishable libs with generators, they always point to the source directory.
  
> projects/i18n/src/lib/loader/translation-loader.ts:9:46 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/lib/service/translation-service.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.

And the first place in the error complaining that actually crosses both libraries is the following:

>  projects/components/src/common/activity-reporter/activity-reporter.module.ts:9:28 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/public-api.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.
  The file is in the program because:
    Imported via '@vcd/i18n' from file '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src/common/activity-reporter/activity-reporter.module.ts'

# Workaround
Set paths to point to the `dist`

# Feedback
Looking for anything I can try to help me understand the difference between the setup from a clean nx workspace or what I have done to mine. Some within my company have said that they have only ever got it to work pointing to `dist` but I have an [example where it doesn't seem to be needed](https://github.com/juanmendes/bg-hoard/pull/4/commits/0958c92f60dc02609e24f759dadb86636b2e49d4#diff-0b280a445be167f54cd916c0718c952b8e0d4ca9621903d05eec25efd4c6ed6dR22).

issue.title: DRAFT: Add nx
issue.body:
# Description
There are two 'bugs' I'm trying to understand as I add NX to this repo and I run `nx build components` which depend on the `i18n` library.

##  `nx build components` does not seem to trigger an `nx build i18n` 

The graph for this project correctly identifies that `i18n` depends on `components` but `nx build components` does not seem to trigger an `nx build i18n`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/549331/198699916-0e21e868-39c9-41cd-a9c0-a9737b26bef7.png)


## Compilation errors
Even if I build `i18n` manually, I still get a whole lot of compilation errors of type `"'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files."`.

issue.title: Fix crash in rpmtsCheck() if rpmtsRun() fails
issue.body:
The preexisting logic in `doCheck` is very helpful for extracting and displaying problems, but the call to `rpmtsCheck` itself should not be re-executed if the failure occurred after the initial check. Once `rpmtsClean()` has been called, data within `pTS` has been emptied and `rpmtsCheck` will segfault on NULL dereference.

Also address a few potential issues with the lifetime of the problem objects:
* The `rpmps` object is ref-counted internally and should be released with `rpmpsFree`; the latter function frees all of the problems within it when the ref count reaches 0.
* If multiple problems are reported, then `pErrorStr` needs to be freed multiple times.

---

_NOTE: This is my first (attempted) contribution to this project, so I wasn't sure how/which tests to re-run. I'd appreciate any and all feedback you have for me to make this PR acceptable._

issue.title: CVE-2007-4559 Patch
issue.body:
# Patching CVE-2007-4559

Hi, we are security researchers from the Advanced Research Center at [Trellix](https://www.trellix.com). We have began a campaign to patch a widespread bug named CVE-2007-4559. CVE-2007-4559 is a 15 year old bug in the Python tarfile package. By using extract() or extractall() on a tarfile object without sanitizing input, a maliciously crafted .tar file could perform a directory path traversal attack. We found at least one unsantized extractall() in your codebase and are providing a patch for you via pull request. The patch essentially checks to see if all tarfile members will be extracted safely and throws an exception otherwise. We encourage you to use this patch or your own solution to secure against CVE-2007-4559. Further technical information about the vulnerability can be found in this [blog](https://www.trellix.com/en-us/about/newsroom/stories/research/tarfile-exploiting-the-world.html).

If you have further questions you may contact us through this projects lead researcher [Kasimir Schulz](mailto:kasimir.schulz@trellix.com).

This does not seem to be the way that nx wants things since when I create two publishable libs with generators, they always point to the source directory.
  
> projects/i18n/src/lib/loader/translation-loader.ts:9:46 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/lib/service/translation-service.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.

And the first place in the error complaining that actually crosses both libraries is the following:

>  projects/components/src/common/activity-reporter/activity-reporter.module.ts:9:28 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/public-api.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.
  The file is in the program because:
    Imported via '@vcd/i18n' from file '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src/common/activity-reporter/activity-reporter.module.ts'

# Workaround
Set paths to point to the `dist`

# Feedback
Looking for anything I can try to help me understand the difference between the setup from a clean nx workspace or what I have done to mine. Some within my company have said that they have only ever got it to work pointing to `dist` but I have an [example where it doesn't seem to be needed](https://github.com/juanmendes/bg-hoard/pull/4/commits/0958c92f60dc02609e24f759dadb86636b2e49d4#diff-0b280a445be167f54cd916c0718c952b8e0d4ca9621903d05eec25efd4c6ed6dR22).

issue.title: Fix crash in rpmtsCheck() if rpmtsRun() fails
issue.body:
The preexisting logic in `doCheck` is very helpful for extracting and displaying problems, but the call to `rpmtsCheck` itself should not be re-executed if the failure occurred after the initial check. Once `rpmtsClean()` has been called, data within `pTS` has been emptied and `rpmtsCheck` will segfault on NULL dereference.

Also address a few potential issues with the lifetime of the problem objects:
* The `rpmps` object is ref-counted internally and should be released with `rpmpsFree`; the latter function frees all of the problems within it when the ref count reaches 0.
* If multiple problems are reported, then `pErrorStr` needs to be freed multiple times.

---

_NOTE: This is my first (attempted) contribution to this project, so I wasn't sure how/which tests to re-run. I'd appreciate any and all feedback you have for me to make this PR acceptable._

issue.title: CVE-2007-4559 Patch
issue.body:
# Patching CVE-2007-4559

Hi, we are security researchers from the Advanced Research Center at [Trellix](https://www.trellix.com). We have began a campaign to patch a widespread bug named CVE-2007-4559. CVE-2007-4559 is a 15 year old bug in the Python tarfile package. By using extract() or extractall() on a tarfile object without sanitizing input, a maliciously crafted .tar file could perform a directory path traversal attack. We found at least one unsantized extractall() in your codebase and are providing a patch for you via pull request. The patch essentially checks to see if all tarfile members will be extracted safely and throws an exception otherwise. We encourage you to use this patch or your own solution to secure against CVE-2007-4559. Further technical information about the vulnerability can be found in this [blog](https://www.trellix.com/en-us/about/newsroom/stories/research/tarfile-exploiting-the-world.html).

If you have further questions you may contact us through this projects lead researcher [Kasimir Schulz](mailto:kasimir.schulz@trellix.com).

issue.title: DRAFT: Add nx
issue.body:
# Description
I am not able to  get a publishable library to depend on another unless I set tsconfig's `paths` to point to the `dist` directory. I get the following kinds of errors when I run `nx build components` and `components` depends on `i18n`. This does not seem to be the way that nx wants things since when I create two publishable libs with generators, they always point to the source directory.
  
> projects/i18n/src/lib/loader/translation-loader.ts:9:46 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/lib/service/translation-service.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.

And the first place in the error complaining that actually crosses both libraries is the following:

>  projects/components/src/common/activity-reporter/activity-reporter.module.ts:9:28 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/public-api.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.
  The file is in the program because:
    Imported via '@vcd/i18n' from file '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src/common/activity-reporter/activity-reporter.module.ts'

# Workaround
Set paths to point to the `dist`

# Feedback
Looking for anything I can try to help me understand the difference between the setup from a clean nx workspace or what I have done to mine. Some within my company have said that they have only ever got it to work pointing to `dist` but I have an [example where it doesn't seem to be needed](https://github.com/juanmendes/bg-hoard/pull/4/commits/0958c92f60dc02609e24f759dadb86636b2e49d4#diff-0b280a445be167f54cd916c0718c952b8e0d4ca9621903d05eec25efd4c6ed6dR22).

Notably, this improves performance and changes host function syntax.

issue.title: DRAFT: Add nx
issue.body:
# Description
There are two 'bugs' I'm trying to understand as I add NX to this repo and I run `nx build components` which depend on the `i18n` library.

##  `nx build components` does not seem to trigger an `nx build i18n` 

The graph for this project correctly identifies that `i18n` depends on `components` but `nx build components` does not seem to trigger an `nx build i18n`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/549331/198699916-0e21e868-39c9-41cd-a9c0-a9737b26bef7.png)


## Compilation errors
Even if I build `i18n` manually, I still get a whole lot of compilation errors of type `"'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files."`.


> projects/i18n/src/lib/service/translation-service.ts:1:1 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/lib/service/translation-service.ngtypecheck.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.


> projects/i18n/src/lib/loader/translation-loader.ts:1:1 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/lib/loader/translation-loader.ngtypecheck.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.

  
> projects/i18n/src/lib/loader/translation-loader.ts:9:46 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/lib/service/translation-service.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.

And the first place in the error complaining that actually crosses both libraries is the following:

>  projects/components/src/common/activity-reporter/activity-reporter.module.ts:9:28 - error TS6059: File '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/i18n/src/public-api.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files.
  The file is in the program because:
    Imported via '@vcd/i18n' from file '/Users/jmendes/github/jm-vcd-ui-common/projects/components/src/common/activity-reporter/activity-reporter.module.ts'

# Feedback
Looking for anything I can try to help me understand and fix the bug.
